The type must be of the form external/<company>/<event> where <company> and <event> are strings no greater than 64 characters each; forward slashes are not allowed. These strings describe the <company> that manufactured the device that was the source of the <event>.

member.name: M:VxSdkNet.VolumeGroup.GetVolumeRelations(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2{VxSdkNet.Filters.Value,System.String})
member.summary:
Get all possible volume relations for this volume group (both linked and non-linked). Each linked volume shall be included in the volume group while each non-linked volume shall be excluded. Note that a volume may only be linked to 1 volume group.
Available filters: AdvancedQuery, AllTags, AllPrivateTags, Linked.
member.param: The collection filters to be used in the request.
member.returns: A List of related volume resources.

member.name: T:VxSdkNet.Schedule
member.summary: The Schedule class represents a recording schedule. A schedule is a group of 0 or more resources associated with a set of time and/or event based schedule triggers that, when any are active, cause the scheduled action to be performed.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.TimeTableId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the time table assigned to the schedule trigger, if any.
member.value: The unique time table identifier, if any.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time, from 1 to 300 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active immediately after it becomes active ("duration recording").

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.PreTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time, from 0 to 30 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active prior to when it becomes active ("pre alarm").
member.value: The pre trigger time in seconds.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.PostTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time, from 0 to 300 seconds, to continue to consider the schedule trigger active when it becomes inactive ("post alarm").
member.value: The post trigger time in seconds.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.InactiveEventSituationType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of event that will cause this schedule trigger to no longer be considered active. If set, the schedule trigger event state will no longer be considered active. If not set, the schedule trigger event status will immediately be considered inactive after event occurs.
NOTE: This property is ignored if is not set.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the schedule trigger.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.Framerate
member.summary: Gets or sets the recording framerate level.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.EventProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the event properties that will activate the schedule.
member.value: A List containing the event properties.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.EventSituationType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of event that will activate the schedule trigger. If set, the schedule trigger is considered an "event" trigger, otherwise it is considered a "timed" trigger. If set, the schedule trigger only activates when this type of event occurs.
See for information on when the trigger will deactivate.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.Action
member.summary: Gets or sets the action performed when the schedule trigger activates.

member.name: M:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: T:VxSdkNet.NewScheduleTrigger
member.summary: The NewScheduleTrigger class represents a new schedule trigger configuration that specifies a time range and an optional event that together act as a trigger to activate a schedule.

member.summary: Gets the estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the export is 100% ready to be streamed. This will only be populated when the status is preparing or ready.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.ExportStream.PercentComplete
member.summary: Gets a value from 0 to 100. This specifies how close stream preparation is to completion, where 100 indicates that stream is ready for streaming. This will only be populated when the status is preparing, failed, or ready. In a failed state, this represents how much progress was made (if any) prior to the failure.

member.name: T:VxSdkNet.Gap
member.summary: The Gap class represents a span of time that a clip should exist for a particular data source on a particular data storage but for some reason the clip does not exist. Not all instances of gaps may be detectable by the system and thus may not be reported.

member.name: M:VxSdkNet.DataStorage.AddClip(VxSdkNet.NewClip)
member.summary: Saves the data specified in the new clip to this data storage. Once saved, the data will be represented as a new clip (not immediately available). Data that is already saved will not be retrieved again. If there is overlap with data that is already saved, only the new data will be saved.
member.param: The new clip to add to the data storage.
member.returns: The Result of the request.

member.name: T:VxSdkNet.NewClip
member.summary: The NewClip class represents a request to create a new clip on a data storage using data from another data storage. The new clip will have the same recording type as the data it is based on, defaulting to Timed. Typically this is used to save data from a camera supporting edge storage to a recorder.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.DataSource.PruningThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold, in hours, after which recordings older than this are eligible for pruning. Any recorded media retained longer than the threshold will be pruned as needed to free space on disk for recording. If set, this value overrides the threshold in Configuration::Storage. This is only applicable when the data source type is video. A value of 0 will disable pruning.

member.name: M:VxSdkNet.PtzController.RelativePercentageMove(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the camera position within a percentage relative to the devices current field of view.
member.remarks: The rotational x and y parameters are used to move within a percentage of the current field of view of the camera. For instance, if the x parameter were 50 and the y parameter were -50, the pan/tilt would move halfway to the edge of the field of view along the x axis and halfway to the field of view along the negative y axis from its present position.
member.param: Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (X axis). Positive values are to the right, negative values are to the left. Range: -100 to 100.
Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (Y axis). Positive values are up, negative values are down. Range: -100 to 100.
member.returns: The Result of the relative percentage move.

member.name: M:VxSdkNet.PtzController.RelativeMove(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the camera position relative to the current position.
member.param: The degree to pan relative to the current X position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
The degree to tilt relative to the current Y position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
The magnification level relative to the current Z position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
member.returns: The Result of the relative move.

member.summary: Gets the Y (tilt) coordinate absolute position, in degrees, relative to the (0, 0) position. The -180 position is bottommost while the 180 position is topmost (digital presets only).

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.Preset.X

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.Configuration.Storage.PruningThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold, in hours, after which recordings older than this are eligible for pruning. Any recorded media retained longer than the threshold will be pruned as needed to free space on disk for recording. This only applies to data source having type video. A value of 0 will disable pruning (pruning may be enabled on a per data source basis still, see: DataSource::PruningThreshold).

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum count threshold that must be met before an event is triggered. This value is used by both the bidirectional capacity events and the sliding window events

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.ObjectLineCounter.LineCounterType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of line counter (i.e. unidirectional, bidirectional, or omnidirectional). The type defines how the line counter increments and maintains its counts.

member.summary: Gets or sets the friendly name associated with a bidirectional counters left count.

member.name: P:VxSdkNet.ObjectLineCounter.EventWindowSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the events time window for testing if the counts maximum threshold is met within this window. For example, if max count threshold = 100 and event_window_secs = 3600 then an event would be generated if 100 objects cross a counting line over the last hour. Once the hour elapses the event triggers base count is reset and the count window slides to the next hour and starts over. Ignored if max count threshold is not set.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether line counter specific events for this line counter are enabled.

member.name: T:VxSdkNet.ResourceLimits
member.summary: The ResourceLimits class represents a map of limits related to a resource. A resource will supply a limit for any field that is supported but does not have a valid value available. The presence of a limit indicates that the associated field is supported, regardless of whether the field is present in the resource representation or not.

member.name: T:VxSdk.IVxSchedule
member.summary: Represents a recording schedule. A schedule is a group of 0 or more resources associated with a set of time and/or event based schedule triggers that, when any are active, cause the scheduled action to be performed.

member.summary: If set, the event only activates when it occurs with these . Ignored if no event is set.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxScheduleTrigger.timeout
member.summary: Amount of time, from 1 to 300 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active immediately after it becomes active (duration).

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxScheduleTrigger.preTrigger
member.summary: Amount of time, from 0 to 30 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active prior to when it becomes active (pre-alarm).

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxScheduleTrigger.postTrigger
member.summary: Amount of time, from 0 to 300 seconds, to continue to consider the schedule trigger active when it becomes inactive (post-alarm).

member.name: T:VxSdk.IVxScheduleTrigger
member.summary: Represents a schedule trigger. A schedule trigger is a time range and an optional event that together act as a trigger to activate a schedule. The schedule trigger is considered active when all of its time and event attributes indicate it should be active. An active schedule trigger will perform its configured action.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxRule.timeTableIds
member.summary: The unique identifiers of the time tables used by this rule. This rule will only automatically run its script if a trigger occurs during the times contained by the time tables specified here. If empty, no active time ranges are available for this rule (it must be manually triggered). If null, no time filters will be applied (the new rule is always active).

member.name: T:VxSdk.IVxManualRecording
member.summary:
DEPRECATED: Replaced by IVxRecording.
Represents an instance of an active manual recording (the action, not the recorded clip). Each manual recording will cause its specified data source to be manually recorded by all data storages that the data source is assigned to. Only one manual recording per user per data source is allowed. A clip created via the application of a manual recording will have an event value of manual.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewSituation.type
member.summary: The situation type. The type must be of the form external/<company>/<event> where <company> and <event> are strings no greater than 64 characters each; forward slashes are not allowed. These strings describe the <company> that manufactured the device that was the source of the <event>.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewSituation.sourceDeviceId
member.summary: The unique source identifier. This field acts an optional constraint on the source of events for this situation. If specified, any events matching the situation type must also match this SourceDeviceId in order for the situation to apply.

member.summary: Indicates whether events generated from this situation shall be persisted or immediately be discarded.

member.name: T:VxSdk.VxNewSchedule
member.summary: Represents a new schedule to be created. A schedule is a group of 0 or more resources associated with a set of time and/or event based schedule triggers that, when any are active, cause the scheduled action to be performed.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.action
member.summary: The action performed when the schedule trigger actives.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.framerate
member.summary: The framerate level to record at. Defaults to .

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.eventProperties
member.summary: If set, the event only activates when it occurs with these properties. Ignored if no is set.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.timeout
member.summary: Amount of time, from 1 to 300 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active immediately after it becomes active ("duration recording"). The schedule trigger will become inactive when this time has elapsed (though the may continue to keep it active at this point). No timeout is applied if the value is less than 1. Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.preTrigger
member.summary: Amount of time, from 0 to 30 seconds, to consider the schedule trigger active prior to when it becomes active ("pre alarm"). Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.postTrigger
member.summary: Amount of time, from 0 to 300 seconds, to continue to consider the schedule trigger active when it becomes inactive ("post alarm"). Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.eventPropertySize
member.summary: The size of .

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.timeTableId
member.summary: The unique identifier of a time table. If set, the schedule trigger will only be active during the time range(s) defined by this time table.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.inactiveEventSituationType
member.summary: The IVxEvent::situationType of event that will cause this schedule trigger to no longer be considered active. If set, the schedule trigger event state will no longer be considered active. If not set, the schedule trigger event status will immediately be considered inactive after event occurs. NOTE: This field is ignored if is not set.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.id
member.summary: The unique identifier of the schedule trigger. If not supplied, the system will create the identifier.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger.eventSituationType
member.summary: The IVxEvent::situationType that will activate the schedule trigger. If set, the schedule trigger is considered an "event" trigger, otherwise it is considered a "timed" trigger. If set, the schedule trigger only activates when this type of event occurs. See for information on when the trigger will deactivate.

member.name: T:VxSdk.VxNewScheduleTrigger
member.summary: Represents a new schedule trigger to be created. A schedule trigger is a time range and an optional event that together act as a trigger to activate a schedule. The schedule trigger is considered active when all of its time and event attributes indicate it should be active. An active schedule trigger will perform its configured action.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxRuleTrigger.sourceRef
member.summary:
The resource reference that this trigger is associated with. Limited to one resource only. If empty, no source filter will be applied (all sources are valid).
Supported resources are limited to the following resource types: kDataSource, kDevice, kDataStorage, and kTag. This trigger will evaluate to true only if its event source matches one of these sources. If the type is a device, this will match against the events source device id. If the type is a data source, this will match against the service_property_id value within the event properties. Finally, if a source is a tag, this will match against the tag applied to the situations service type.

member.summary: The data interfaces available for retrieval of data from this data source.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSource.retentionLimit
member.summary: The maximum retention (in hours) that the system will keep recorded data for this data source. Any recorded data that exceeds this limit will be deleted. If is also set, the lowest non-zero value will be used. A value of 0 means no retention limit will be used.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSource.pruningThreshold
member.summary: The threshold, in hours, after which recordings older than this are eligible for pruning. Any recorded media retained longer than the threshold will be pruned as needed to free space on disk for recording. If set, this value overrides the threshold in IVxConfiguration::Storage. This is only applicable when the data source type is video. A value of 0 will disable pruning.

member.summary: Clears this instance.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.level
member.summary: The Smart Compression level. Offers a trade-off between image quality and compression efficiency. When not disabled, dynamic GOP can be enabled for each stream.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.tertiaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the tertiary (3rd) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.septenaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the septenary (7th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.senaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the senary (6th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.secondaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the secondary (2nd) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.quinaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the quinary (5th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.quaternaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the quaternary (4th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.primaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the primary (1st) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.octonaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the octonary (8th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.nonaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the nonary (9th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.name: F:VxSdk.IVxDataSourceConfig.SmartCompression.denaryDynamicGop
member.summary: If not 0, dynamic GOP is enabled for the denary (10th) stream and the value is the maximum number of frames between I-frames.

member.summary: Defines the minimum confidence filtering value for detected objects in a video scene. Minimum confidence is defined as percentage of confidence represented as a decimal. member.name: M:VxSdk.IVxPtzController.RelativePercentageMove(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the camera position within a percentage relative to the devices current field of view.
member.remarks: The rotational x and y parameters are used to move within a percentage of the current field of view of the camera. For instance, if the x parameter were 50 and the y parameter were -50, the pan/tilt would move halfway to the edge of the field of view along the x axis and halfway to the field of view along the negative y axis from its present position.
member.param: Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (X axis). Positive values are to the right, negative values are to the left. Range: -100 to 100.
Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (Y axis). Positive values are up, negative values are down. Range: -100 to 100.

Zoom relative to the current position. It is expressed in terms of magnification * 100, such that if a user wished to zoom in 2X the current magnification, the value would be 200, 2.5X the current magnification would be 250. A negative number may not be valid if it is outside the bounds of the field of view.
member.returns: The Result of the request.

member.name: M:VxSdk.IVxPtzController.RelativePercentageMove(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the camera position within a percentage relative to the devices current field of view.
member.remarks: The rotational x and y parameters are used to move within a percentage of the current field of view of the camera. For instance, if the x parameter were 50 and the y parameter were -50, the pan/tilt would move halfway to the edge of the field of view along the x axis and halfway to the field of view along the negative y axis from its present position.
member.param: Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (X axis). Positive values are to the right, negative values are to the left. Range: -100 to 100.
Percentage of the current field of view of the camera (Y axis). Positive values are up, negative values are down. Range: -100 to 100.
member.returns: The Result of the request.

member.name: M:VxSdk.IVxPtzController.RelativeMove(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the camera position relative to the current position.
member.param: The degree to pan relative to the current X position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
The degree to tilt relative to the current Y position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
The magnification level relative to the current Z position. Negative values pan left, positive values pan right.
member.returns: The Result of the request.

member.summary: Ordered list of points that make up the wrong-way zone. The zone is defined as an simple convex quadrilateral. Do NOT repeat the starting vertex at the end of the listit is implicitly included.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxObjectWrongWayZone.vector
member.summary: Defines the wrong-way zones vector. The vector points in the direction that indicates the correct direction of flow. An objects heading opposite the vector are considered to be heading in the wrong direction.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxObjectWrongWayZone.minTriggerAngle
member.summary: Defines the minimum angle between a detected objects trajectory vector and the wrong-way zones vector. Any object that is traveling at an angle >= the minimum from the reference vector will be considered heading in the wrong-direction.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxObjectLineCounter.lineCounterType
member.summary: Defines the type of line counter (i.e. unidirectional, bidirectional, or omnidirectional). The type defines how the line counter increments and maintains its counts.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxObjectLineCounter.maxCountThreshold
member.summary: The maximum count threshold that must be met before an event is triggered. This value is used by both the bidirectional capacity events and the sliding window events.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxObjectLineCounter.eventWindowSecs
member.summary: Define the events time window for testing if the counts maximum threshold is met within this window. For example, if is 100 and is 3600 then an event would be generated if 100 objects cross a counting line over the last hour. Once the hour elapses the event triggers base count is reset and the count window slides to the next hour and starts over. Ignored if is not set.

member.name: T:VxSdk.VxLimits
member.summary:
Represents a map of limits related to a resource.
A resource will supply a limit for any field that is supported but does not have a valid value available. The presence of a limit indicates that the associated field is supported, regardless of whether the field is present in the resource representation or not.

member.summary:
The site specific LDAP container; unique per VideoXpert site. This DN should contain the (which is a suffix of this full DN).
Should be supplied if is true; ignored otherwise.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxLdapValidationCredentials.vxRootDn
member.summary:
The LDAP container under which VideoXpert system information for all sites is stored; this should be the same for all sites.

member.summary:
The password for the superuser DN account in the LDAP directory that performs searches.
Should be supplied if or are true; ignored otherwise.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxLdapValidationCredentials.searchDnAccount
member.summary:
The superuser DN account in the LDAP directory to use for performing searches there.
If SSO is true, this account should have write permissions on the . Should be supplied if or are true; ignored otherwise.

member.name: F:VxSdk.VxLdapValidationCredentials.useLdapUsersAndRoles
member.summary: Indicates whether or not LDAP will be used to manage users and roles. false to only use the LDAP server for authentication; the VideoXpert system will manage users and roles itself. true to manage user accounts and role assignments in the LDAP system. Note that permissions on roles will still be managed by the VideoXpert system.
